Hi

I am trying to integrate HubSpot for my ios project. Adding the sdk using the swift package manager, is that the only option? Can't i use cocoapods?

Using Swift Package Manager is the only supported way currently. You could also build a framework and include that directly in your project if you know how - but its not a documented or supported method.

Cocoapods support isn't planned, and you should be aware that its winding down as a product: <https://blog.cocoapods.org>

You should be actively planning on how to get away from depending on pods, in general.

Alright. Was working on a flutter plugin to allow me integrate this in my apps

<https://github.com/shuttlershq/HubSpot_flutter>

Was able to get the plugin running and use in my app.

I have other questions.

1. iOS deployment target is 15.0
2. Android min sdk version is 26.0
Are the above constraints compulsory?

I am looking at a ios deployment target of 12.0 and Android min sdk of 21. Would these work with the native sdks provided?
